reviewText: This is a high energy workout.  If you don't like upbeat and perky, this is not for you.  But some, like me, like perky.  Different instructers step up and take turns with the aerobic sections.  There are dancy ones and more straight forward ones.  The music is fun and varied. The aerobics are floor and step.  I never did get one of those fanny lifting steps.  I just use my 8" step for everything.  I still get an effective workout.  You will use light weight dumbbells and need a dowel or broomstick for two of the segments.  The abdominal section is great with this rocking move that I don't have on any other tapes.  I did not find the steps complicated.  L steps are not difficult to learn and that is just one segment. I like tapes that provide aerobics and toning. I get a great workout from this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really do like the firm series....and this is another video that is easy to learn the moves...fun, and good music to exercise to...and another great thing...only a forty minute workout.  So not a lot of time...still get a real workout!

reviewText: This is an oldie but a goodie.  The ab section is fantastic!  A boredom buster with the mix of instructors and routines.
Title: N/A

reviewText: What's interesting is that when I first brought this tape home and tried it for the first time, I HATED it.  On first glance, I thought it was corny, the instructors too peppy, and the moves were just silly - and I had already been using the Firm Body Sculpting System 1, so I knew the instructors.Needless to say, I gave it another chance and now this video is actually one of my favorites.  It contains mostly cardio, the sections were you use weights are still cardio sections (4-limb aerobics, not actual weight lifting).  I use this video on days when I am letting my muscles rest but I still want to burn calories.  The tape alternates between short step, high step and floor work and also includes bridge work and some pretty tough ab work.  I always feel like I get a good workout from this tape.  It runs about 45 minutes (including warm up, cool down & abs).  I like the fact that it uses 3 different instructors (despite the fact that Allie is the only one displayed on the cover).  If you don't get the moves down right away, concentrate on footwork and don't use your arms.  Once you get the footwork down, then add the arms.One issue with this tape (for me anyway), is that it includes a lot of hopping - bunny hops, jumping jacks, jogging, plyo jumps, etc.  I am not as much into jumping and prefer lateral movement, plus you might keep this in mind if you live in an apartment.  Some of the set looks a bit dated, but the music is generally pretty good.  I don't like the fact that Allie is so obviously airbrushed on the cover.  Doesn't she look great without that???  And finally, as usual, The Firm tapes do not mention water and this is an ongoing issue that I have with The Firm.  So, if you are getting this video, keep water around and drink plenty of it while you work out.  :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are an experienced Firm user then beware this video is strictly cardio and while it uses some light weights in a couple of segments it's just to get your heart rate up.  It's also only about 25 minutes long and that's short for a Firm video.  Having said that I really enjoyed the content of this video.  It's got some particularly challenging segments using the 14 inch step.  I love these.  My heart rate goes up and I know it's giving my legs an awesome workout.  Some of the other routines are moving quickly and so if you are a beginner you won't keep up.  Having only that small step to use will cause you to miss cues and get frustrated.  So for some people just getting started I would recommend setting up a regular step so you have a bigger platform on which to work.  That way you don't have to worry as much with your feet not making solid contact with the little 6 inch step you can get from the Firm.  You experienced Firm users should find this a good video to rotate in when you want a quick cardio routine.  I use it when I am stringing 2 or 3 cardio routines together and want them to be quick and short because my boredom factor is low.
summary: Cardio Firm not a true toning video
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video is mainly cardio, but there are different forms of it in this video. There are 4 step segments, some hi/lo impact aerobics, and 4 limb aerobics using lighter weights. Tall box climbs are also featured in this video, where you step up and down on the tall box which really elevates the heartrate. Three different instructors (Lisa Kay, Nancy Tucker, Allie Strickland) lead this workout alternating between segments. There is also a fun abs section near the end of the video. It's a fun cardio workout with high energy music. You will need a step and a tall box or stool, light weights and a dowel or broom handle for balance. Not a really tough workout, but does the job in getting the heartrate up.
Title: N/A
